name: Mahakaleshwar

location.astronomical_significance: Prime Meridian of Ancient India, Tropic of Cancer intersection

deity.form_title: The Lord of Time, The Devourer of Death

significance.philosophy: Mahakala - The Absolute Time that devours relative time. He is the substratum upon which the drama of time plays out.
unique_distinctions: Most renowned for the pre-dawn Bhasma Aarti tradition

description: The Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga represents the absolute and terrifying aspect of the Divine as Mahakalaâ€”the Great Time, the Devourer of Time. Unlike other Jyotirlingas associated with healing or auspiciousness, Mahakaleshwar is the embodiment of entropy, the force that dissolves the universe at the end of an epoch. The underground sanctum houses the only South-facing Jyotirlinga, confronting Yama (Death) directly. The daily Bhasma Aarti, where the Linga is smeared with cremation ash at dawn, is a visceral reminder of mortality and liberation.
secret_hook: Here, at the ancient Prime Meridian where astronomers measured cosmic time, the Lord who transcends all Time awaits. With ash of the cremation ground adorning him, Mahakala grants freedom from the ultimate fearâ€”death itself.

sapta_puri_status.verse: Ayodhya Mathura Maya Kashi Kanchi Avantika | Puri Dvaravati chaiva saptaita mokshadayakah
sapta_puri_status.meaning: Ujjain (Avantika) is one of seven cities capable of bestowing Moksha
